quiz.question: Which physical property primarily determines pitch?
Which scale describes perceived loudness roughly doubling per 10 dB increase?
What acoustic feature forms vowel identity by resonant peaks in the vocal tract?
What name describes sound below 20 Hz?
Which term describes frequency peaks caused by a room's dimensions?
What acoustic phenomenon yields beats equal to the frequency difference of two tones?
What effect causes an apparent pitch change from a moving sound source?
Which filter type preserves low frequencies while attenuating high frequencies?
Which laser-based technique measures surface vibration via Doppler frequency shift?
What handheld device measures sound intensity levels in decibels?
What term describes amplification when driving frequency matches natural frequency?
Which decibel formula uses 20 times the base-10 log of a pressure ratio?
What technology uses reflected sound to locate underwater objects?
Which vocal technique emphasizes harmonic overtones by shaping resonances?
Which formula estimates reverberation time using room volume and absorption?
